Commit r1360729 introduced one more dependency for building Tomcat, a 'patch' executable.

Although 'patch' is usually available on Linux, and I guess Mac OS, it must be installed on Windows, AFAIK. 'patch' executable for Windows is available here:

  http://gnuwin32.sourceforge.net/packages/patch.htm

text:
Thank you for the patch.

Two notes on the original issue

1. I still hope that an updated version of commons-dbcp is released at some time before Tomcat 8, so that using patch tool were not necessary.

2. As an alternative measure, it is possible to skip building DBCP.
Technically, it can be done by setting the property "no.build.dbcp", though it is kind of a trick, as it is an internal property used to store result of a <condition>. E.g.:

no.build.dbcp=true

(It would be better to have some explicit documented property to configure this feature. Such as that it would skip not only building, but also downloading DBCP sources).
